VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
Special investigation 2018C0220034 7/11/18 report date
The agency was cited for a violation of R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff. Three
residents during outside recreation were able to scratch rudimentary tattoos into their
skin under staff supervision. The agency implemented a corrective action plan that
entailed updating their supervision policy. The policy amendment called for vigilant
supervision defined as being watchful, fully active, awake and alert. This consultant
verified the implementation of this corrective action plan.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
